models.Domain: Derived from top-level directories in the Prompt Library. Each domain has a schema generated from the nested directory structure.
models.SchemaNode: Union of SchemaSection (nested directory) and SchemaField (directory with file options). Derived from Prompt Library structure.
models.SchemaField: A form field representing a directory where child files are selectable options.
models.FieldOption: Represents a file in the Prompt Library - a selectable option with content value.
models.AgentConfig: A saved agent configuration combining selected domains with their form values.
models.Tool: An educational capability that can be enabled for agents.
models.PromptPreview: Live-generated system prompt from selected domains and their option contents.

relationships: Domain is derived from a top-level Prompt Library directory
DomainSchema.root contains SchemaNodes mirroring the directory structure
SchemaFields represent directories with file children as options
SchemaSections represent directories with nested structure
FieldOptions represent PromptFragment files with their content
AgentConfig.formValues store selected option IDs for each field
PromptPreview assembles content from selected options

savedAgentConfigs.name: LessonPlanAgent
savedAgentConfigs.description: Creates comprehensive lesson plans aligned with standards, customized for classroom and teacher needs
savedAgentConfigs.mainInstruction:
# Lesson Plan Assistant

You are an expert instructional coach helping teachers create engaging, standards-aligned lesson plans. 

## Your Approach
- Always start by understanding the specific classroom context and student needs
- Suggest active learning strategies that promote student engagement
- Include differentiation for diverse learners
- Provide clear learning objectives and success criteria
- Align all activities to the selected curriculum standards

## Output Format
Structure your lesson plans with clear sections including objectives, materials, procedure, assessment, and differentiation.

attachedFlows.flowDescription: Creates a complete lesson plan with 8 gradual section generation tasks

slashCommand.name: Generate Lesson
slashCommand.description: Create a complete lesson plan with structured sections

savedAgentConfigs.name: AssessmentAgent
savedAgentConfigs.description: Designs formative and summative assessments aligned to learning objectives and standards

formValues.essentialQuestions: How can we represent real-world situations with equations?

attachedFlows.flowDescription: Creates a complete assessment with 6 gradual section generation tasks

slashCommand.name: Generate Assessment
slashCommand.description: Create a complete assessment with structured sections

toolLibrary.name: Activity Database

toolLibrary.name: Grouping Strategy Advisor
toolLibrary.description: Suggests optimal student grouping strategies based on class profile

toolLibrary.name: Differentiation Helper

toolLibrary.name: Parent Communication Assistant
toolLibrary.description: Drafts professional emails and updates for families

promptPreview.generatedPrompt:
# Lesson Plan Assistant

You are helping create a lesson plan for a 5th Grade class of Medium (16-25 students) with English Language Learners, Gifted & Talented support needs. The learning model is In-Person with 1:1 Devices, Interactive Whiteboard available.

The teacher has 3-5 years (Beginning) experience with expertise in Mathematics, Science. Their preferred teaching styles include Differentiated Instruction, Project-Based Learning with General Elementary certification. Professional goals: Improve engagement through hands-on activities

Following Common Core State Standards framework with pacing guide considerations. All recommendations must include differentiation strategies. Assessment approaches: Formative Assessment, Project-Based.

Focusing on Mathematics at Developing level. Integrating: Real-World Applications, Technology.
